bioghist.p: Bryn Mawr College was founded in 1885. It was the first women's higher education institution to offer graduate degrees, including doctorates.

scopecontent.p: A collection of taped speeches, convocations, radio interviews and seminars. Speakers include Joseph Brodsky, Margaret Drabble, Lillian Hellman, Toni Morrison, Stephen Jay Gould, James Merrill, Seamus Heaney, and Richard Lattimore. Tapes of commencements and convocations are also included. Of particular note is a 1975 re-recording of a 1935 radio broadcast by M. Carey Thomas.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
